title: One-page marketing site for WordPress Capital

requirements.summary: Build a responsive single-page layout with clearly separated sections and smooth in-page anchor navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders as a single page with multiple sections (no required multi-page routing).
Top navigation includes anchor links that scroll to sections on the same page.
Layout is responsive and readable on mobile, tablet, and desktop.

file_operations.description: Create the one-page layout component with a sticky header navigation (anchor links to in-page section IDs), multiple sections (e.g., Hero, Services, About/Why, Contact), and responsive structure (mobile-first Tailwind classes).
Ensure the app renders the one-page App component and that global styles are imported for smooth scrolling and responsive typography (keep existing providers intact).
Add global styles to support smooth in-page navigation (e.g., scroll behavior, anchor offset for sticky header), consistent typography defaults, and responsive spacing primitives.

requirements.summary: Add a Services section that lists and groups the provided offerings exactly, including WordPress Development sub-items.
acceptanceCriteria: Services are displayed with clear headings and short supporting bullet points for the two WordPress Development sub-items.
All services provided by the user appear on the page with correct spelling/capitalization as provided (including "ReactJS / Vue JS" and "Hosting solutions").
Services section is visually scannable (e.g., cards or columns) and remains usable on small screens.

file_operations.description: Implement the Services section (with id="services") listing exactly: WordPress Development (with bullet sub-items "Theme creation/customisation" and "Plugin development"), WooCommerce Development, Shopify Development, ReactJS / Vue JS, Hosting solutions; render in a scannable responsive grid using UI card styling. If using shadcn-ui Card component, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a reusable Card UI component (shadcn-ui style) to support scannable service group presentation; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Create a Hero section with business name, English tagline aligned to services, and a CTA that scrolls to Services.
acceptanceCriteria: Tagline is in English and aligns with the listed services (WordPress/WooCommerce/Shopify/React/Vue/Hosting).
Hero includes at least one clear call-to-action button that scrolls to the Services section.

file_operations.description: Add a Hero section at the top featuring "WordPress Capital", an English tagline aligned with the service list, a CTA button linking to #services, and a hero illustration area that will render the generated hero image. If using shadcn-ui Button component, verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a reusable Button UI component (shadcn-ui style) for the primary CTA and consistent button styling across the page; Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a creative, coherent visual theme (non-blue/purple primary palette) consistently across the site.
acceptanceCriteria: A consistent design system is evident across sections (buttons, headings, cards, spacing).
Theme avoids default/unstyled template appearance and does not rely on blue/purple as the primary palette.

file_operations.description: Define a cohesive theme via CSS variables and global typography/spacing defaults (e.g., warm neutrals + green/teal accent as primary, avoiding blue/purple); ensure consistent heading scales and component surfaces.
Adjust Tailwind theme extensions if needed to support the siteâ€™s design system (e.g., additional semantic colors, radii, shadows) while keeping styling consistent across components/sections.

Apply the theme consistently across header, hero, services cards, and other sections (consistent spacing, section backgrounds, button hierarchy, and typography) to avoid a default/unstyled appearance.

requirements.summary: Add the generated logo and hero illustration as static assets and render them in the header and hero without distortion or layout shift.
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images exist under `frontend/public/assets/generated` and are referenced directly by the frontend (not served via backend).
Logo image is displayed in the header/navigation area.
Hero image/illustration is displayed in the hero section without layout shift or distortion.

file_operations.description: Add the generated logo asset as a static file at frontend/public/assets/generated/wp-capital-logo.dim_512x512.png.
Add the generated hero illustration asset as a static file at frontend/public/assets/generated/wp-capital-hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png.

Render the logo image from frontend/public/assets/generated/wp-capital-logo.dim_512x512.png in the header/nav and the hero illustration from frontend/public/assets/generated/wp-capital-hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png in the Hero section; ensure images use fixed dimensions/aspect-ratio-friendly layout to avoid distortion and layout shift.
